variants.Description in input context: M26I mutation reduces DJ-1 expression, particularly in a null background (knockout mouse embryonic fibroblasts); homozygous M26I mutation causes loss of DJ-1 protein.

C106A mutation specifically abolished binding to ASK1 and the cytoprotective activity of DJ-1; designed higher order oxidation mimicking [C106DD]DJ-1 non-covalently bound to ASK1 even in the absence of hydrogen peroxide and conferred partial cytoprotection.
C46A mutation led to constitutive ASK1 binding.
C53A mutation led to constitutive ASK1 binding.
